page.title: 14Wimbledon Football Ground
page.content: The football pitch is in excellent condition.To the right is a huge stand where there is usually trouble.An iron railing prevents fans running onto the pitch.To the right again are more stands.These are for the away team supporters.All stands are made of very flimsy wood, but the ground is going to be improved in 1986, to avoid the danger of fire.A small whistle is blown and play begins.The fans cheer on their teams and groan at missed chances.They wave scarves and songs. At each match there is a small child, dressed in miniature kit, who plays the part of the club mascot.The club's nickname is Wimbledon Super Dons.
